inclusion.criterion: lab tests such as full blood count, coagulation factors, blood chemistry, general urine test, and urine culture will be requested.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: cardiovascular evaluation will also be requested
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: 3/d Bladder Diary forms will be handed out for completion and must be presented on the next visit.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: informed consent will be explained to the patient, and this must be signed if she wants to participate in the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: tests such as pad test, uroflowmetry, Valsalva maneuver to demonstrate SUI urodynamics, cystometry, and urethral pressure profile (UPP) will be run and sent to the center that was randomly selected for the procedure.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: prescription for 3 days of analgesics and antibiotics will be given after the procedure in either of the center, upon release from the hospital.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: data such as medical condition, vital signs, general urine test, urine culture, uroflowmetry and postvoid residual volume measured by ultrasound will be collected on visits 2 and 3 (2 and 6 weeks post-op).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A 3/d Bladder Diary will be requested for visit 4.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: general urine test, and urine culture will be requested on visits 5 and 6 (12 and 24 months).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ICIQ-SF, SUSW and King's Health questionnaires will be applied on visits 4, 5 and 6.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patients who require further treatment for stress urinary incontinence will continue with the 24 month evaluation and will remain in the study until the end as programmed.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Inability to walk (allowed with walking aids)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Prolapse of pelvic organs beyond the vaginal vestibule during stress
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Current chemotherapy or history of pelvic radiotherapy
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Systemic disease affecting bladder function (i.e., Parkinson's disease, multiple sclerosis, bifid spinal, spinal cord injury or any trauma)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of augmentation cystoplasty or artificial sphincter
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Nerve stimulator implant for urinary symptoms
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 25-year-old pregnant woman who developed a sudden onset of fever and chills, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. She also complains of dysuria, urgency, and frequency. Her vital signs are: T = 39.7ºC, P = 117, R = 20, and BP = 113/74 mm Hg.
